reviewText: Judging from all the 5 star reviews, what could go wrong?  The first half was mainly recorded in the maestro's snowy garden. Was it snowy?  It looked fake to me.  The audience sitting around round tables watching in rather light clothing didn't appear to be cold at all.After every song, the orchestra stands up to accept their applause.  I never saw that before.  (every single song!)  The between song patter was really hokey and long winded.  Also the staged scenes of children playing were ridiculous.  The young daughter of one of the orchestra ladies was just ok with her ballet, and when they cg'd her "flight" we almost turned it off.The orchestra, chorus, and soloist were very good though.Then come the second half of the show inside a beautiful old church.  It was like a totally different show.  Much less inane patter, much more beautiful music along with a huge male choir.So bottom line,2 stars for the first half, 5 stars for the second.Sound and picture were pristine.Have a great holiday!Jerry
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is one of the best Andre Rieu DVDs I have seen and I have seen many and own several. It is well worth the time. People of all ages  will love this. It really got our family in the Christmas spirit. He shares his home and life with the audience. Andre and his musicians are down to earth and funny at times. Another thing that was neat is how he encorporates Hannukah in the repertoir. I highly recomend it!

reviewText: Andre Rieu is a master showman.  His albums are superb and come from assembling a magnificent orchestra, a selection of beautiful music, presented in a spectacular way, with some of the most talented vocalists to ever record a song.  Rieu himself is a consummate showman and conductor, who synthesizes all of the pieces into a wonderful production.  I was introduced to him by my wife when he played at a small Wallingford CT theater.  I was hooked.  These shows are more than just great music.  Try it, you'll like it!

reviewText: A television special on PBS (where else?)  introduced me to Andre Rieu a few years ago, and I am a great fan of his music, and orchestra.  I saw him  perform twice in Las Vegas, and own 5 DVD's and three CDs of his music.  This is a beautiful DVD--all Christmas music performed from his home....Beautifully mixed and edited, and I know I will enjoy this DVD all year round!Way to go, Andre!  Thank you!
Title: N/A

reviewText: 'Home for the Holidays' is absolutely the most beautiful Christmas music I have ever heard. And Andre always makes his concerts so exciting. The concert began at his castle in his winter garden and was completed in a cathedral across the street from his home. Andre invites you into his home and makes you feel very welcome.His version of "Walking in the Air" with the ten year old Rosa dancing in the air was incredible. The acoustics in the cathedral were phenomenal. Besides his orchestra, the men's choir, and children's choir accompanied him on many songs at the cathedral. The Hallelujah was so awesome, it could have been sung in heaven. The last song, Silent Night was precious and holy; again, just beautiful. If you could own only one Christmas DVD, this would be the one to get. You will never grow tired of it.
summary: I felt like I was there
